known_issues: Speech-to-text task addition still not working; error indicates back-end is not ready.

existing_features.title:
Make readiness checks use real initialization error state so the app shows accurate backend connection status.

Specifically:
- In frontend/src/hooks/useActorWithReadiness.ts, consume the new error state from useActor and set `initError` accordingly.
- Ensure the derived flags behave consistently:
  - `isInitializing` is true while the actor query is fetching and no actor is available yet.
  - `isReady` is true only when an actor exists and the query is not fetching.
  - `initError` is non-null when actor initialization failed (query error).

new_feature_requests.summary:
Update the actor initialization hook to avoid failing actor creation due to access-control initialization and to surface initialization errors.

Specifically:
- In frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, make access-control initialization (_initializeAccessControlWithSecret) conditional on a non-empty caffeineAdminToken.
- Wrap the access-control initialization call in try/catch so that actor creation can still succeed (return the actor) even if access-control init fails.
- Expose the React Query error state from the actor query (e.g., return an `error` field alongside `actor` and `isFetching`) so the UI can distinguish “still loading” vs “failed to connect/initialize”.

Improve diagnostics for actor initialization to speed up troubleshooting of “backend not ready” reports.

Specifically:
- Add structured console diagnostics around actor creation and access-control initialization steps in frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts using existing diagnostics utilities (frontend/src/utils/deploymentDiagnostics.ts and/or frontend/src/utils/actorInitDiagnostics.ts).
- Ensure diagnostics do not include sensitive values (do not log the admin token).

projectName: Fix false “Backend is not ready” by hardening actor initialization and surfacing real init errors
